unittitle_ssm: Photographs of the former Half Moon Hotel on Coney Island
abstract_ssm: The Photographs of the former Half Moon Hotel on Coney Island consist of 21 8 x 10 inch black-and-white photographic prints showing exterior, interior, and detail views of what was originally the Half Moon Hotel. When  the photographs were taken on April 10, 1991 by Li-Saltzman Architects, the building served as a nursing home. The photographs were taken as part of a mitigation plan on behalf of the owners of the building, the Metropolitan Jewish Geriatric Center.
